PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001.synopsis: The player has spotted the first blood stain after succesfully investigating the pigeon feathers.
PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_PigeonFeather, interact with the feather and succeed the roll, then teleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_PigeonBlood_001

BroadsheetSeller_AD.synopsis: Silfy tries to sell her newspapers

AD_Postmaster_Welcome.synopsis: A welcoming one-shot AD which the postmaster plays when the player enters the posthouse.

PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood000.synopsis: Player passes a nature check and identifies the first sign of the missing pigeons.

Courier.synopsis: Player can talk to courier to get some information about missing pigeons for Posthouse quest

EquerryGroomArguing_AD.synopsis: Mar'hyah and Dringo having an argument

AD_PaperGirl.synopsis: Paper girl at Posthouse uses Stelmane's death as the hot topic to sell some broadsheets

EquerryGroom.synopsis: The player can talk to Marhyah or Dringo to mention they found Scratch. Depending on who the player spoke to first, either Dringo or Mat'hyah will be the initial speaker.In either case, Mar'hyah will dominate the conversation.Mar'hyah wants to reclaim him as property of the couriers' office. The player can convince her to release Scratch, and potentially even to leave the kennels altogether. If they fail to persuade her, Scracth is locked up, and Oyster Boy can get fired.
EquerryGroom.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_AngryMarhyah and speak with her.

Postmaster.synopsis: Postmaster Danzo Arkwright asks the player to find missing letters and will offer a reward on delivery. Reading the letters first will allow the player to blackmail the postmaster.
Postmaster.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Post_Postmaster and speak to the Postmaster.

CrimeReaction_GalesTressym.synopsis: Crime reaction of Tara when you mess with her stuff

PaperGirl.synopsis: Paper girl at Posthouse will mention that Stelmane is dead

PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym.synopsis: Not Gale approaches TaraNote: when Gale is avatar and camp night NIGHT_Gale_TressymJoin has happened, the players will have seen a tressym before.

PAD_Jaheira_StelmaneDead.synopsis: Jaheira repsonds to the news that Stelmane is dead
PAD_Jaheira_StelmaneDead.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATeleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_Point_BroadsheetSellerba9e4f9e-5c90-4d76-8bba-5b7be82ed9a2Talk to Silfy and buy a broadsheetRead the broadsheet

CapturedDog_02.synopsis: When the player interacts with the dog at the Posthouse, he narrator will describe their situation

Pigeon.synopsis: Players can use Speak with Animals to talk to the pigeon at the Post house to find out more information regarding the missing letters. The pigeon will point the player towards the Open Hand Temple roof.
Pigeon.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Post_PigeonCptBlackBeak and use SwA to talk to the pigeon.

CapturedDog_01.synopsis: When the player interacts with the dog at the Posthouse, he narrator will describe their situation

EquerryGroomDog_AD.synopsis: Scratch has been cornered by Mar'hyah, and is refusing to get back in his kennel. His hackles are raised, he's frightened and angry. Oyster boy is pleading with Mar'hyah to leave Scracth alone.
EquerryGroomDog_AD.how_to_trigger: add Scratch to camp with "oe dog2camp"Teleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_AngryMarhyahSpeak to Mar'hyah and mention ScratchGo to camp and speak to Scratch, mention Mar'hyah and DringoFinish long rest and teleport back to S_WYR_Posthouse_AngryMarhyah

CourierDog.synopsis: speak to courier dog at posthouse once the situation is resolved
CourierDog.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATeleport to S_WYR_Posthouse_AngryMarhyah and speak with her. oe dog2campGo to camp, and tell dog to go to the PosthouseSpeak to Mar'hyah again and resolve the situation.Speak to dog

PAD_GaleSpottedTressym.synopsis: Gale has spotted Tara, his pet tressym, in Wyrm's Crossing. He reacts excitedly.

Guard_001.synopsis: Fist Rockbreed stands watch outside of the Posthouse and is allergic to dogs.

StelmaneDead_EmperorAD.synopsis: After the player reads the Gazette for the first time, they read about the death of Duke Stelmane, to which the Emperor responds in an AD.

BroadsheetSeller.synopsis: Interact with Silfy as the broadsheet seller near the Post House.Small introduction + option to buy broadsheets.

GalesTressym.synopsis: Player approaches Tara and sees she is carrying an item. Player tries to convince Tara to give the item over. If Gale is in party he will be favoured speaker and will recognize Tara and why she has a magic item with her.

PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001_3.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001_3.text: Could the missing letters be over there?
PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001_3.context: NodeContext: Gale: Last thought almost to self, 'what have I become' - joke.

PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood001_1.text: More pigeon remains... looks like it was dragged toward the temple.

Pigeon_001_2.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_001_2.text: Hmm. A little wet under the wing for our unit... the Commander will soon straighten you out.
Pigeon_001_2.context: NodeContext: Experienced pilot, doesn't have time to deal with you

BroadsheetSeller_AD_0.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_AD_0.text: Baldur's Mouth Gazette. Today's news, tomorrow's... history?

BroadsheetSeller_AD_1.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_AD_1.text: The latest news is... um... brand new! Only in the Baldur's Mouth Gazette.

BroadsheetSeller_AD_2.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_AD_2.text: Baldur's Mouth Gazette. For stories with, um, teeth!

BroadsheetSeller_AD_3.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_AD_3.text: Buy your papers here. Um, please?

AD_Postmaster_Welcome_0.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
AD_Postmaster_Welcome_0.text: Ah - a new face! Something to send? Don't be shy!

PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood000_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood000_0.text: Pigeon feathers. Maybe from one of the postmaster's birds.

PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood000_2.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerSpotsPigeonBlood000_2.text: Pigeon feathers. No sign of the bird.

Courier_0.speaker: Jeffers Morston
Courier_0.text: They can't fly straight if they're disturbed.

Courier_2.speaker: Jeffers Morston
Courier_2.context: NodeContext: Hushed, he's already told you once

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_1.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_1.text: I should send you back to the fish pits, Oyster Boy.
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_1.context: NodeContext: with a sigh, being a little cruel

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_4.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_4.text: I'm still learning! There's so much to -
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_4.context: NodeContext: Earnest, trying to convince her

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_5.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_5.text: When will I get to train the dogs again, Miss Mar'hyah?

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_0.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_0.text: When you prove yourself not to be an incompetent idiot.
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_0.context: NodeContext: witha sigh, like she's sick of the question

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_3.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_3.text: Ah. I see. Maybe next tenday then.
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_3.context: NodeContext: trying to sound positive when he's just been insulted to his face

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_7.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_7.context: NodeContext: Irritable, she thought this was done

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_9.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_9.text: That was my next job. I was just raking the -

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_2.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_2.text: No excuses! I can't abide excuses.

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_8.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_8.text: When's the last time you changed the straw? Filled the water troughs?
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_8.context: NodeContext: Irritable, making Oyster boy feel stupid

EquerryGroomArguing_AD_11.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomArguing_AD_11.text: You're supposed to do it every day. Bloody moron.

AD_PaperGirl_0.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
AD_PaperGirl_0.text: Stelmane's death - crime of passion? Or deeper conspiracy?

AD_PaperGirl_1.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
AD_PaperGirl_1.text: Stelmane's murder still unsolved! City Watch under scrutiny!

AD_PaperGirl_2.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
AD_PaperGirl_2.text: Stelmane's dead! Read all about it!

EquerryGroom_20.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_20.context: NodeContext: A woman saying 'woof', not somebody actually barking. Looks at you with annoyance, and then shouts 'WOOF'. [Gwen Lee]

EquerryGroom_56.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_56.text: A charming effort - but you can't fool me.

EquerryGroom_19.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_19.text: You're not a dog. So what the hell are you doing in my kennels?

EquerryGroom_23.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_23.text: Unless you want me to shove you in one of these cages, stop barking and start speaking.

EquerryGroom_126.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_126.text: It's fine. I have a very robust sense of humour.

EquerryGroom_127.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_127.text: I'd like to buy a dog.

EquerryGroom_115.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_115.text: They're not for sale. These are courier dogs - trained to follow orders, read maps, and protect their deliveries with their lives.

EquerryGroom_113.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_113.text: They're worth more than their weight in gold.

EquerryGroom_64.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_64.text: I think I found one of your dogs - Scratch.

EquerryGroom_86.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_86.text: Found him, did you? I can't say I'm surprised - Gomwick never kept him on a tight leash.

EquerryGroom_117.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_117.text: Bring him here and I'll give him a once-over for you. Check him for worms and so on.
EquerryGroom_117.context: NodeContext: A sore point between them

EquerryGroom_13.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_13.text: Oh, yes please. I'd love to see him.

EquerryGroom_44.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_44.text: He's a good dog. We'd both love to see him again.

EquerryGroom_46.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_46.text: Scratch! It's good to see you boy.

EquerryGroom_48.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_48.text: Shut up, Dringo. And get back to work!

EquerryGroom_51.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_51.text: And you've been slacking as well, Scratch m'boy.
EquerryGroom_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: raising a hand, ready to strike Scratch, who cowers and whimpers

EquerryGroom_73.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_73.text: This dog is property of Sword Coast Couriers. I'll take him off your hands now.

EquerryGroom_85.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_85.text: You shouldn't raise your hand to him like that.

EquerryGroom_110.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_110.text: I thought Scratch belonged to Gomwick?

EquerryGroom_70.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_70.text: Gomwick was his handler, not his owner.
EquerryGroom_70.context: NodeContext: Like she's stating the obvious

EquerryGroom_4.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_4.text: Is there any reward for returning him?

EquerryGroom_92.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_92.text: You're lucky I don't report you for stealing him in the first place.

EquerryGroom_128.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_128.text: He lives with me - you can't just take him.

EquerryGroom_125.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_125.text: He is not 'property,' he is Scratch. Don't you dare threaten him.

EquerryGroom_15.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_15.text: I can do whatever I please - he's my dog. Now get out - this is a private yard.

EquerryGroom_10.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_10.text: I'm sorry Scratch, there's nothing I can do.

EquerryGroom_99.speaker: Scratch
EquerryGroom_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

EquerryGroom_21.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_21.text: That's more like it. Some obedience at last.
EquerryGroom_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mar'hyah approaches Scratch, and ushers him into his kennel (cage). NodeContext: approving of Scratch's behaviour

EquerryGroom_119.speaker: Scratch
EquerryGroom_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.NodeContext: Heartbroken

EquerryGroom_69.speaker: Scratch
EquerryGroom_69.text: I don't want to be alone again.
EquerryGroom_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.NodeContext: Heartbroken

EquerryGroom_33.speaker: Scratch
EquerryGroom_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch watches us through the bars of his cage. He is lost to us for now.

EquerryGroom_123.speaker: Scratch
EquerryGroom_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch lies down sadlyNodeContext: heart-broken as he realises what's happening

EquerryGroom_84.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_84.text: I'll break every bone in your body before I let you hurt that dog.

EquerryGroom_134.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_134.text: You - you'll do no such thing.
EquerryGroom_134.context: NodeContext: nervous - not so cocky against someone her own size (so to speak)

EquerryGroom_131.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_131.text: And if you do, I'll call the guards. Who do you think they'll side with? The dog is my property.

EquerryGroom_65.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_65.text: He's forgotten his training. He'll be a terrible influence on the rest of your hounds.

EquerryGroom_1.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_1.text: I'm not surprised. Gomwick always indulged him. And he's got a spark in his eye I don't like - looks lively.

EquerryGroom_24.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_24.text: Take the useless mutt if you're so inclined. I'll have nothing more to do with him.
EquerryGroom_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs over to the player. The player pets him, relieved.

EquerryGroom_66.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_66.text: It's not just Scratch. She's always hurting the dogs.
EquerryGroom_66.context: NodeContext: Desperate, finally found someone to listen

EquerryGroom_52.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_52.text: Shut your mouth, Dringo. Last warning.
EquerryGroom_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mar'hyah threatens Dringo, who's visibly scared of her

EquerryGroom_38.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_38.text: I'm sorry, Dringo - I only care about Scratch.

EquerryGroom_17.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_17.text: And now you have him. So get out of my kennels.
EquerryGroom_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

EquerryGroom_78.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_78.text: As for you - that's a tenday's pay docked. Now, back to work.

EquerryGroom_18.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_18.text: I hear Lord Gortash abhors animal abuse. Perhaps I should report you to him.

EquerryGroom_54.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_54.text: You have lost your way, hound-keeper. Leave, before I teach you to respect these creatures properly.

EquerryGroom_47.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_47.text: Fine. You think you can do a better job without me - be my guest.

EquerryGroom_77.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_77.text: They're a useless bunch of mongrels. You're welcome to them!

EquerryGroom_75.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_75.text: How I run my kennels is none of your concern. Take your mutt, and get out of my yard.
EquerryGroom_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch runs past Mar'hyah to the player. The player fusses him, relieved.

EquerryGroom_130.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_130.text: As for you, Dringo. Get out of my yard. You're finished here.

EquerryGroom_35.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_35.text: Nothing a smack or three of the rod won't fix.

EquerryGroom_88.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_88.text: This noble beast has tasted true freedom - he will never be brought to heel again.

EquerryGroom_76.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_76.text: You might be able to bully a dog and a boy, but threaten me and I'll snap you in two.

EquerryGroom_12.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_12.text: I suspect she mistreats the dog and you, boy. Is this true?

EquerryGroom_29.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_29.text: Sorry Scratch, she's right. You don't belong to me.

EquerryGroom_129.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_129.text: Is this dog one of yours?

EquerryGroom_8.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_8.text: You were being awfully harsh on the boy when I arrived.

EquerryGroom_67.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_67.text: It's the only way to teach him. He behaves worse than the dogs, and makes more of a mess.

EquerryGroom_45.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_45.text: Which means you're not a dog. So what the hell are you doing in my kennels?

EquerryGroom_27.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_27.text: Get out. I'm short-handed, in case you've forgotten.

EquerryGroom_28.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_28.text: I'll keep an eye on Scratch for you. Don't worry.

EquerryGroom_43.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_43.text: I hope that bloody dog bites you.

EquerryGroom_62.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_62.text: This is a private kennels. Get out.

EquerryGroom_93.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_93.text: I'm sorry for what happened. Scratch will be happier with you.

EquerryGroom_106.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_106.text: I should get back to work.

EquerryGroom_5.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_5.text: You - you got rid of her.

EquerryGroom_114.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_114.text: I'll do a better job looking after these dogs than she ever did. I promise.

EquerryGroom_36.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_36.text: Yeah. I'm caring for the courier dogs. Mar'hyah's my boss.

EquerryGroom_60.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_60.text: She's mean. But dad says she'll toughen me up.

EquerryGroom_96.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_96.text: She's an educator. She says if somebody doesn't listen, shout louder. And if they still don't listen, fetch the rod.

EquerryGroom_63.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_63.text: Your dad sounds like a smart man.

EquerryGroom_25.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_25.text: Maybe. I don't know. He's usually drunk.

EquerryGroom_80.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroom_80.text: And you - what do you want? This is a private yard.

EquerryGroom_6.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_6.text: I'd kill her and take her place.

EquerryGroom_91.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_91.text: The harder you beat a dog, the more it bites back.

EquerryGroom_74.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_74.text: True, boy, but only if you hone the anger she causes you. Make it sharp.

EquerryGroom_122.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_122.text: That's why I need to work hard in the kennels every day. To get tough.

EquerryGroom_133.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_133.text: Sure she's not a bully? Abuse and strict training are far from the same, boy.

EquerryGroom_97.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_97.text: That woman seems like a harsh taskmaster.

EquerryGroom_58.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_58.text: I think I found one of your dogs - Scratch.

EquerryGroom_87.speaker: Oyster Boy Dringo
EquerryGroom_87.text: Scratch! I thought he was dead.

EquerryGroom_81.speaker: Player
EquerryGroom_81.text: Recognise this dog? I think he belongs here.

Postmaster_2.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_2.text: Deliveries are on hold while we sort out some, er, logistical issues. My apologies.

Postmaster_27.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_27.text: Go on, bugger off. I've a business to run, in case you hadn't noticed.

Postmaster_37.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_37.text: Clear off. I've business to attend to.
Postmaster_37.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound intimidating, but very. very worried

Postmaster_62.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_62.text: Welcome... again... to Sword Coast Couriers - to Send and to Serve. Delivery not guaranteed.

Postmaster_70.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_70.text: If you happen to stumble across those letters, do bring them by. There'd be a tip in it for you.

Postmaster_98.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_98.text: Welcome to Sword Coast Couriers - to Send and to Serve. Delivery not guaranteed.
Postmaster_98.context: NodeContext: Employee spiel. "To Send and to Serve" said proudly, like a company motto. "Delivery not guaranteed" rushed, as though a hidden terms and condition line

Postmaster_107.speaker: Player
Postmaster_107.text: I'm sorry to tell you - I found the body of one of your couriers. He carried this letter.

Postmaster_147.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_147.text: Gomwick... that's a real shame. Fine courier, he was.
Postmaster_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo a letter. Danzo looks at it for a moment, then puts it awayNodeContext: Tutting to himself - another problem to solve

Postmaster_58.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_58.text: Stumped how I'll replace him - most want to get into the city these days, not leave it. We've had to cut our courier services completely.

Postmaster_29.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_29.text: I'll tell you, it's left me in a right pickle. I've sent what I can by pigeon, but now something's attacking them and all!

Postmaster_131.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_131.text: 'Become a postmaster, Danzo. It'll be easy.' Nobody mentions having to spend your evenings hunting for pigeon carcasses, do they?

Postmaster_39.speaker: Narrator
Postmaster_39.text: *You sense there's more to his anxiety than a few missing letters.*

Postmaster_113.speaker: Player
Postmaster_113.text: You must be particularly keen to retrieve the Zhentarim letters about the Iron Flask.

Postmaster_99.speaker: Player
Postmaster_99.text: Level with me. What's really going on here?

Postmaster_78.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_78.text: Oh, well, er, one of the missing letters is my own correspondence.

Postmaster_115.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_115.text: A personal matter. Nothing serious. But you can understand, if people think I can't even deliver my own letters, I'd be finished!

Postmaster_42.speaker: Player
Postmaster_42.text: Especially if they discovered you were meddling in Guild business on the Zhentarim's behalf.

Postmaster_18.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_18.text: You - you read it? Technically that's interfering with someone else's property. I should report you to the nearest manip.
Postmaster_18.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

Postmaster_34.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_34.text: Tell you what - give it here and we'll say no more about it.
Postmaster_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo beckons for the player to hand the letters overNodeContext: nervous but acting like this is doing you a favour

Postmaster_137.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_137.text: I'll give you a nice little bonus as well. A finder's fee. What do you say?
Postmaster_137.context: NodeContext: Desperate, trying to act casual

Postmaster_142.speaker: Player
Postmaster_142.text: I've got another buyer lined up. I'd make it a very generous fee.

Postmaster_148.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_148.text: Fine. Just give me the letter.
Postmaster_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo

Postmaster_69.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_69.text: Forget you saw anything. This never happened.

Postmaster_130.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_130.text: If you'd shown that letter to anyone but the Zhent, you'd already be dead.

Postmaster_73.speaker: Player
Postmaster_73.text: Give me everything the Zhentarim paid you, or this letter is the least of your worries.

Postmaster_93.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_93.text: You really think I'm intimidated by the likes of you?

Postmaster_91.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_91.text: That letter's not leaving this room. Neither are you.
Postmaster_91.context: NodeContext: Steely, about to start a combat with you.

Postmaster_10.speaker: Player
Postmaster_10.text: It'd be a shame if anyone told the Zhentarim you lost this. A real shame...

Postmaster_140.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters

Postmaster_82.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_82.text: Here's your fee. Our little secret, all right?

Postmaster_83.speaker: Player
Postmaster_83.text: No, thanks. I'm keeping the letter.

Postmaster_71.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_71.text: You bloody arse rat. Fine - keep it. Much good it'll do you.

Postmaster_97.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_97.text: Go on, get out of my post house. We're closed.

Postmaster_119.speaker: Player
Postmaster_119.text: Is this the letter you were looking for?

Postmaster_17.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_17.text: Ah. You've opened it, I see.
Postmaster_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters (unseen)

Postmaster_109.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_109.text: Well, let's cut to the chase. Go on. Tell me how much your silence is going to cost me.
Postmaster_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo pays the playerNodeContext: Suddenly businesslike, his charm vanished

Postmaster_121.speaker: Player
Postmaster_121.text: Erm, give me all of your gold. Or I start breaking fingers.

Postmaster_35.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_35.text: Fine. Take it all, and keep your trap shut.
Postmaster_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands over gold (unseen)NodeContext: Reluctant, scared you'll get him in trouble

Postmaster_103.speaker: Player
Postmaster_103.text: Everything you have. It will take a lot of gold to make me forget that horrible letter I definitely read.

Postmaster_66.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_66.text: You... you didn't read it, did you?
Postmaster_66.context: NodeContext: Realising the player is lying to them

Postmaster_112.speaker: Player
Postmaster_112.text: I didn't read it. I'm not here to blackmail you.

Postmaster_136.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_136.text: You aren't? Right. Well, er, here's a little something anyway. A gift.
Postmaster_136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

Postmaster_57.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_57.text: Let's not mention this to anyone else. Our little secret, all right?

Postmaster_120.speaker: Player
Postmaster_120.text: Is this the letter you were looking for?

Postmaster_52.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_52.text: Thank the gods! Unopened as well. Oh, what a relief. My customers will be most pleased.
Postmaster_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo (unseen. Danzo inspects the letters, then puts them away (unseen)NodeContext: Palpable relief

Postmaster_43.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_43.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

Postmaster_128.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_128.text: Please, take this. You've earned it ten times over.
Postmaster_128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

Postmaster_101.speaker: Player
Postmaster_101.text: Any idea where the birds went missing?

Postmaster_61.speaker: Player
Postmaster_61.text: Do you want me to track down your letter?

Postmaster_80.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_80.text: You'd do that? Well, if it's not too much bother I - yes, I'd appreciate the help.
Postmaster_80.context: NodeContext: Very hesitant - torn between needing the letters found, and fear that you'll read them

Postmaster_54.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_54.text: Bring me the letter - unopened, of course - and I'll happily compensate you for your troubles.

Postmaster_16.speaker: Player
Postmaster_16.text: I can track this letter down. But I'll need my expenses paid up front.

Postmaster_129.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_129.text: I suppose there's no harm in you taking a look. Here's something to get you started.
Postmaster_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some money (unseen)NodeContext: flustered, trying not to sound too desperate

Postmaster_88.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_88.text: Bring me the letter - unopened - and you'll get the rest.

Postmaster_14.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_14.text: I'll pay when that letter's on my counter, unopened. Not one moment before.
Postmaster_14.context: NodeContext: Jocular scolding, putting an end to the discussion

Postmaster_86.speaker: Player
Postmaster_86.text: Any idea where the birds went missing?

Postmaster_56.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_56.text: Not the foggiest. Normally they fly true as an elven arrow.

Postmaster_116.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_116.text: Something nearby is snatching them, I can tell you that much.

Postmaster_143.speaker: Player
Postmaster_143.text: I could find the pigeons for you. My fees are very reasonable.

Postmaster_7.speaker: Player
Postmaster_7.text: I'd be happy to take a look.

Postmaster_108.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_108.text: Well, er, if it's not too much trouble, I'd be much obliged.

Postmaster_47.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_47.text: Any letters you find, bring them back to me - unopened, of course - and there's some gold in it for you.

Postmaster_49.speaker: Player
Postmaster_49.text: Good luck with that. I've got bigger problems to solve.

Postmaster_28.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_28.text: I'm sure you do. What's a few letters gone astray at a time like this? Hardly life and death, is it?
Postmaster_28.context: NodeContext: Hiding his panic - it might be life and death for him

Postmaster_74.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_74.text: Well, we've had to change the policy. Hard to send letters by road when there's a rampaging army of fanatics bearing down on you.
Postmaster_74.context: NodeContext: Jolly, as if this is just a run-of-the-mill problem

Postmaster_125.speaker: Player
Postmaster_125.text: I'm not sending anything. You can drop the sales routine.

Postmaster_55.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_55.text: No routine here - we're the best in the city, delivering from Candlekeep to Waterdeep and beyond!
Postmaster_55.context: NodeContext: Not rising to the allegation, staying positive

Postmaster_77.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_77.text: At least, normally that's the case. We've had to limit our service - hard to send letters by road when there's a rampaging army of fanatics bearing down on you.
Postmaster_77.context: NodeContext: Bragging, then hesitantly admitting there's a problem

Postmaster_127.speaker: Player
Postmaster_127.text: It's rare to meet someone so cheerful these days. Why the good mood?
Postmaster_127.context: NodeContext: Obnoxiously bright and cheerful customer service

Postmaster_144.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_144.text: I'm alive and well, aren't I? Earning an honest living. Serving my community. I've plenty to be happy about.

Postmaster_114.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_114.text: Though, I will admit it's been tough recently. We've had to cut down our courier routes. Too risky with that army rampaging nearby.
Postmaster_114.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound positive, actually unsettled/nervous about this

Postmaster_126.speaker: Player
Postmaster_126.text: Still need help tracking down those letters?

Postmaster_31.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_31.text: I do, as a matter of fact. Would you be interested in lending a hand?

Postmaster_110.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_110.text: I don't suppose you've, er, stumbled across those letters yet?

Postmaster_38.speaker: Player
Postmaster_38.text: I found a different letter. It was on the body of one of your employees.

Postmaster_9.speaker: Player
Postmaster_9.text: I found the letter intended for the Zhentarim. It made for very interesting reading.

Postmaster_26.speaker: Player
Postmaster_26.text: I found the letter, but it was very difficult. I'm afraid my fees have gone up.

Postmaster_68.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_68.text: Yes, fine, just give me the letters.
Postmaster_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

Postmaster_111.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_111.text: You've no idea the kindness you've done me. What a relief!

Postmaster_134.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_134.text: And I'm afraid my offer has stayed the same. Give me the letters, please.

Postmaster_30.speaker: Player
Postmaster_30.text: On second thoughts, I think I'll hang on to them.

Postmaster_100.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_100.text: Much appreciated. They'll turn up in the last place you look, I'm sure!

Postmaster_84.speaker: Player
Postmaster_84.text: I'm afraid the letters have been destroyed.

Postmaster_6.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_6.text: Better than having them fall into the wrong hands, but still totally unacceptable.

Postmaster_138.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
Postmaster_138.text: Welcome to Sword Coast Couriers - to Send and to Serve. Delivery guaranteed.

Postmaster_32.speaker: Player
Postmaster_32.text: I'm sorry to tell you - I found the body of one of your couriers. He carried this letter.

Postmaster_124.speaker: Player
Postmaster_124.text: I'm not sending anything. You can drop the sales routine.

Postmaster_23.speaker: Player
Postmaster_23.text: It's rare to meet someone so cheerful these days. Why the good mood?

CrimeReaction_GalesTressym_0.speaker: Tara the Tressym
CrimeReaction_GalesTressym_0.text: Now now, darling - you'll want to leave that be.

PaperGirl_12.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_12.text: Bet you want to know all about Stelmane's murder. Hottest topic in Rivington. Apart from the march of the Absolute's army, I s'pose...
PaperGirl_12.context: NodeContext: ever so slightly dejected on final line

PaperGirl_25.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_25.text: But nobody wants to read about a boring old army. Murder's where it's at!

PaperGirl_17.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_17.text: Got today's edition of the Baldur's Mouth Gazette right here. You want one? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperGirl_14.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_14.text: Excellent. You enjoy that one, all right? It's really gory.
PaperGirl_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Paperseller hands over the paper (unseen)NodeContext: with relish on - delighted by gore in the way that kids are

PaperGirl_28.speaker: Player
PaperGirl_28.text: I would, but I don't have enough coin. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperGirl_34.speaker: Player
PaperGirl_34.text: You know murder's not a good thing, right?

PaperGirl_16.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_16.text: It's great for sales. You want one or not?

PaperGirl_35.speaker: Player
PaperGirl_35.text: I was actually more interested in the story about the army of the Absolute. Do you have that one?

PaperGirl_7.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_7.text: Urgh. That's all anyone ever wants to read about. I don't see what all the fuss is about. 'The Absolute' isn't even a real name.

PaperGirl_29.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_29.text: Now Duke Stelmane - there's a person you should be interested in. Especially since she's been murdered. What do you say?

PaperGirl_9.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_9.text: Shame for you though, I'm out of stock for today. Come back tomorrow. I'm sure there'll be some other awful story to whet your eyeballs with!

PaperGirl_15.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_15.text: I knew you'd be back! You're definitely the type to enjoy a nasty bit of news aren't you? You've got that glint in your eye.
PaperGirl_15.context: NodeContext: nervous sales attempt, trying to sound confident. Oblivious to how insulting this sounds

PaperGirl_21.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_21.text: So you'll be wanting a copy of today's edition of the Baldur's Mouth Gazette then? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
PaperGirl_21.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound confident, but a bit desperate at the end

PaperGirl_13.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_13.text: Have I ever told you you're my favourite customer? You are. It's the truth.
PaperGirl_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Paperseller hands over the paper (unseen)NodeContext: child's version of a greasy car salesman

PaperGirl_18.speaker: Player
PaperGirl_18.text: Seems to me that you're the one who likes nasty news.

PaperGirl_19.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_19.text: I like making sales. Not my fault it's the nasty stuff that sells. You want one or not?

PaperGirl_5.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_5.text: Unfortunately for you, I'm all out of stock for today. Come back tomorrow! There'll be something awful to read about, I'm sure. There always is.

PaperGirl_22.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_22.text: You again! You're becoming a bit of a regular aren't you? Not complaining, not complaining!

PaperGirl_33.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_33.text: You want another one? You know news takes time to write, don't you?
PaperGirl_33.context: NodeContext: ever so slightly dejected on final line

PaperGirl_8.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_8.text: Oh go on then, you've twisted my arm. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

PaperGirl_1.speaker: Lilly Beanbottom
PaperGirl_1.text: By the time you've read that one you'll be ready to write your own!
PaperGirl_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Paperseller hands over the paper (unseen)

PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_0.text: That collar looks familiar... does this cat belong to Gale?

PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_2.speaker: Player
PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_2.text: Say - is that Gale's tressym? I wonder what it's doing out here.

PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_4.speaker: Player
PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_4.text: A tressym. Never seen one in the flesh before.

PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_5.speaker: Player
PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_5.text: That symbol on the collar... Gale, is this one yours?

PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_3.speaker: Gale
PAD_NotGaleSpottedTressym_3.text: It is. It's Tara! What's she doing all the way out here?

PAD_Jaheira_StelmaneDead_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_Jaheira_StelmaneDead_0.text: With Stelmane murdered, the Council has an open seat. How timely.
PAD_Jaheira_StelmaneDead_0.context: NodeContext: Grim, dry. A duke was murdered in a 'random attack' at just the time Gortash wanted to step in and claim a Ducal title.

CapturedDog_02_1.speaker: Zola
CapturedDog_02_1.text: Even though mistress is gone, I promise to be a good dog. No - the BEST dog.

CapturedDog_02_2.speaker: Zola
CapturedDog_02_2.text: Thank you for making mistress go away. She was horrid.

CapturedDog_02_3.speaker: Zola
CapturedDog_02_3.text: Mistress says not to talk to strangers.

Pigeon_4.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_4.text: Leave me be, ground-walker. I've reports to prepare.

Pigeon_108.speaker: Player
Pigeon_108.text: Is there any more intelligence available for this mission?

Pigeon_46.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_46.text: You'll want to watch out for the enemy's observation post of course. Tallest point around these parts.

Pigeon_32.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_32.text: It used to make a bloody awful racket, but it's fallen silent. No doubt our enemy has claimed the territory.

Pigeon_117.speaker: Player
Pigeon_117.text: Sorry Commander. I'll return to my mission.

Pigeon_69.speaker: Player
Pigeon_69.text: I'm hailed as [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53],  ex-overseer of the Cult of Bhaal. Currently on medical leave.

Pigeon_9.speaker: Player
Pigeon_9.text: Why does a flock of carrier pigeons need a commander?

Pigeon_13.speaker: Player
Pigeon_13.text: None of that changes the fact you're only a pigeon.

Pigeon_58.speaker: Player
Pigeon_58.text: It sounds like you've quite the fight on your hands. Or, feathers?

Pigeon_91.speaker: Player
Pigeon_91.text: You've got a pretty  high opinion of yourself, for a pigeon.

Pigeon_47.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_47.text: Let's see how tough you are after a taste of real warfare.

Pigeon_51.speaker: Player
Pigeon_51.text: Where did you say your enemy was located?

Pigeon_83.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_83.text: The rooftop west of here. Look out for the observation tower - tallest thing around these parts.

Pigeon_53.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_53.text: You have my thanks. Your service will not be forgotten.

Pigeon_62.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_62.text: Go on, get out. Before I have you court martialled!

Pigeon_63.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_63.text: Our headquarters are for serving fliers only. You. Arre. Dismissed!
Pigeon_63.context: NodeContext: Uppity, annoyed and in command

Pigeon_113.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_113.text: *The pigeon carries itself with an air of dignity, its mannerisms stern and commanding.*

Pigeon_26.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_26.text: *The pigeon avoids your outstretched hand. It glares at you.*
Pigeon_26.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

Pigeon_111.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_111.text: *You bow low and graciously, but the pigeon has no appreciation for your courtesy.*
Pigeon_111.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player performs a sweeping bow. Pigeon idling

[KC] Re-use bow contruction or focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Pigeon_41.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_41.text: *The bird coos its approval. Yet you notice it flinched at the sight of your hand.*
Pigeon_41.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player snaps a smart salute. 

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Pigeon_39.speaker: Player
Pigeon_39.text: Show your palms to the bird.

Pigeon_72.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_72.text: *The bird stares, eyes filled with fury. Perhaps your open hands are a symbol the bird has learned to hate.*
Pigeon_72.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player shows their hands to the pigeon (calming gesture, palms out, hands fairly close together - similar to the open-hand temple's sigil). Pigeon flaps/is angry

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Pigeon_104.speaker: Player
Pigeon_104.text: Hide your hands behind your back.

Pigeon_61.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_61.text: *With the offending articles out of sight, the bird is back at ease. No harm done.*
Pigeon_61.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player puts their hands behind their back

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Pigeon_43.speaker: Player
Pigeon_43.text: Shake your fist at the bird.

Pigeon_40.speaker: Narrator
Pigeon_40.text: *Your threats have no effect. This is an unflappable pigeon.*
Pigeon_40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Pigeon doesn't react

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Pigeon_93.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_93.text: Name and rank? Quickly now - there's a war on.

Pigeon_7.speaker: Player
Pigeon_7.text: Against the Absolute? I know, I'm fighting in it.

Pigeon_57.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_57.text: The Absolute? Poppycock! Enemy propaganda designed to confuse simple minds.
Pigeon_57.context: NodeContext: This is the most ridiculous thing he's ever heard

Pigeon_10.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_10.text: Not your fault you fell for it. You need a strong leader like myself to see the wood under the trees.

Pigeon_81.speaker: Player
Pigeon_81.text: I'm hailed as [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53],  ex-overseer of the Cult of Bhaal. Currently on medical leave.

Pigeon_116.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_116.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player salutes

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

Pigeon_33.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_33.text: Squee? SQUEE? I am Commander Lightfeather and you will address me as such.
Pigeon_33.context: NodeContext: Outraged, as though yelling at a subordinate

Pigeon_15.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_15.text: The army? Those great, clodding dirt snufflers.

Pigeon_30.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_30.text: I am Commander Lightfeather, leader of the finest aerial communication regiment this side of the Chionthar.

Pigeon_88.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_88.text: State your purpose, ground-walker. I don't have all day.

Pigeon_45.speaker: Player
Pigeon_45.text: I found letters carried by some of your birds. I'm afraid they didn't make it.

Pigeon_95.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_95.text: I suspected as much. Bloody shame, but that's the nature of war.

Pigeon_22.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_22.text: Make your report. How did the battle unfold?

Pigeon_66.speaker: Player
Pigeon_66.text: They died horrible, painful deaths. Blood, guts and feathers all over the place.

Pigeon_109.speaker: Player
Pigeon_109.text: They fought to the last feather against a truly formidable foe.

Pigeon_76.speaker: Player
Pigeon_76.text: They were eaten by a flying cat.

Pigeon_106.speaker: Player
Pigeon_106.text: I found letters carried by some of your birds. I'm afraid they didn't make it.

Pigeon_101.speaker: Player
Pigeon_101.text: I hear some of your, er, officers have gone missing recently. What happened to them?

Pigeon_77.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_77.text: Damned awful business - fine fliers the lot of them, gone without a trace.

Pigeon_87.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_87.text: Intelligence is in short supply, but we know our enemy's flanked us on the west side, not one rooftop away.

Pigeon_90.speaker: Player
Pigeon_90.text: I found your pigeons. What was left of them, anyway. There was so much blood...

Pigeon_28.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_28.text: War's a vile business. But, we fight on! We must deliver!

Pigeon_103.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_103.text: As for you, flightless one - it was an honour taking you under my wing. Dismissed!

Pigeon_2.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_2.text: Your reconnaissance is appreciated. This information will be vital in deciding our new strategy. Dismissed!

Pigeon_105.speaker: Player
Pigeon_105.text: I found the enemy you're talking about. Your pigeons fought bravely against it.

Pigeon_73.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_73.text: Of course they did! No doubt it was my training gave them the discipline and resolve to stay in the fight!

Pigeon_42.speaker: Player
Pigeon_42.text: Ah. I'm afraid my tressym is the enemy responsible.

Pigeon_48.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_48.text: A tressym? What nonsense is this? Making up words like a nincompoop.
Pigeon_48.context: NodeContext: Like this is the most insane thing he's ever heard

Pigeon_55.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_55.text: I'm putting you on leave until you regain your senses. Dismissed!

Pigeon_98.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_98.text: And you dare show your face to me? Have you no honour? No respect for the dead?

Pigeon_102.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_102.text: Get out! Never darken the doors of my coop again!

Pigeon_1.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_1.text: We're avoiding the whole area. I won't lose one more beak to the blighter.

Pigeon_27.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_27.text: If you pass that way, beware the sign of the featherless wings. From that rooftop, none return.

Pigeon_23.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_23.text: If you go that way, watch for the bell tower. That's the enemy's observation post.

Pigeon_54.speaker: Player
Pigeon_54.text: I'm looking for some letters that weren't delivered. Any idea where I can find them?

Pigeon_18.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_18.text: Letters? Ah, you mean the top secret communiqués attached by the tall one.

Pigeon_85.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_85.text: If they didn't arrive, no doubt they were attached to one of our recent casualties.

Pigeon_11.speaker: Player
Pigeon_11.text: Why does a flock of carrier pigeons need a commander?

Pigeon_16.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_16.text: Because! We deliver communications across dangerous enemy territory, with only our superior wits and aerial agility to protect us.

Pigeon_89.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_89.text: Even our skills have their limits. We've lost several experienced fliers recently. They knew the risks, but still - damned shame!

Pigeon_3.speaker: Player
Pigeon_3.text: You've got a pretty  high opinion of yourself, for a pigeon.

Pigeon_71.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_71.text: A PIGEON? We are WARRIORS, risking life and feather to deliver vital communiqués on a daily basis.

Pigeon_31.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_31.text: Do you know how many of us have passed on to the great nest in the sky in service to your kind?

Pigeon_80.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_80.text: Fly west of here, to the rooftop of the featherless wings. Face our enemy. Then call me pigeon. Pah!

Pigeon_99.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_99.text: Don't make me repeat myself. Name and rank.

Pigeon_118.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_118.text: You've returned. Yet my fliers have not. I suppose they've flown this mortal coop, so to speak.
Pigeon_118.context: NodeContext: Officious, netural tone (pigeon could be annoyed at you, or not, at this point)

CapturedDog_01_4.speaker: Gustav
CapturedDog_01_4.text: I am under strict orders to speak to no outsiders.

CapturedDog_01_7.speaker: Gustav
CapturedDog_01_7.text: I am also forbidden from receiving scratches, scritches, and belly rubs.

CapturedDog_01_1.speaker: Gustav
CapturedDog_01_1.text: In my mistress' absence, I will look after this place, and any dogs who come here. I promise.

CapturedDog_01_0.speaker: Gustav
CapturedDog_01_0.text: Mistress is gone?! MISTRESS IS GONE! I mean, ahem, such terrible news. She will be missed.
CapturedDog_01_0.context: NodeContext: clearly DELIGHTED that his mistress is gone

CapturedDog_01_8.speaker: Narrator
CapturedDog_01_8.text: *The dog stands to attention, sternly ignoring you.*

EquerryGroomDog_AD_13.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomDog_AD_13.text: Stupid creature. DO AS YOU'RE TOLD.
EquerryGroomDog_AD_13.context: NodeContext: can't believe she needs to tell him this

EquerryGroomDog_AD_1.speaker: Scratch
EquerryGroomDog_AD_1.context: NodeContext: Softening, in spite of herself.

EquerryGroomDog_AD_10.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomDog_AD_10.text: Stop that insufferable crying and get in your kennel.

EquerryGroomDog_AD_4.speaker: Angry Mar'hyah
EquerryGroomDog_AD_4.text: If he doesn't move, I'll give him something to be scared of.
EquerryGroomDog_AD_4.context: NodeContext: Having a dig - Dringo was supposed to clean them. Subtle, not aggressive

CourierDog_5.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_5.text: You came for me. I am ready to go home now.
CourierDog_5.context: NodeContext: Happy to see the player

CourierDog_8.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_8.text: You came for me! I am ready to go home now.
CourierDog_8.context: NodeContext: Happy to see the player

CourierDog_0.speaker: Player
CourierDog_0.text: I'm sorry, Scratch. I never meant for this to happen.

CourierDog_12.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_12.text: Meant for what to happen? When are you taking me home?
CourierDog_12.context: NodeContext: doesn't understand, still believes he will leave soon

CourierDog_6.speaker: Player
CourierDog_6.text: You have to stay here, Scratch. You'll be taken care of.

CourierDog_9.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_9.text: Stay here? I do not want to - I want to go with you.

CourierDog_3.speaker: Player
CourierDog_3.text: We have to say goodbye, Scratch. Be a good boy.

CourierDog_13.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_13.text: I - I see. I will not forget the home you gave me, or the kindness you showed.

CourierDog_2.speaker: Player
CourierDog_2.text: You live here now. Stop whining.

CourierDog_14.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scratch wags his tail, confusedNodeContext: Uncertain - he doesn't understand what's going on

CourierDog_16.speaker: Scratch
CourierDog_16.text: I remember the small one's smell. He was always kind to me.

PAD_GaleSpottedTressym_0.speaker: Gale
PAD_GaleSpottedTressym_0.text: Is that... Tara? Why, I think it is!
PAD_GaleSpottedTressym_0.context: NodeContext: Happy recognition. Has noticed his pet tressym (a cat-like creature) hanging out nearby.

Guard_001_1.speaker: Fist Rockbreed
Guard_001_1.text: Stop staring. You never seen a woman with *sniff* allergies before?
Guard_001_1.context: NodeContext: Too blocked up with allergies to sound overly imposing

StelmaneDead_EmperorAD_0.text: Stelmane is dead? This does not bode well.

BroadsheetSeller_0.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_0.text: Ah! You look like someone who can probably read.
BroadsheetSeller_0.context: NodeContext: nervous sales attempt, trying to sound confident. Oblivious to how insulting this sounds

BroadsheetSeller_20.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_20.text: Can I interest you in, um, a copy of the Baldur's Mouth Gazette? Please buy one... ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
BroadsheetSeller_20.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound confident, but a bit desperate at the end

BroadsheetSeller_44.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_44.text: We're all doing our bit. Better than s-sitting around waiting for the gates to open.

BroadsheetSeller_13.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_13.text: Not the best salesperson, are you?

BroadsheetSeller_5.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_5.text: I'm new, that's all. I just need to p-practice.

BroadsheetSeller_19.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_19.text: It's a really good paper, though. No spelling mistakes in it or anything!
BroadsheetSeller_19.context: NodeContext: Desperately trying to make a sale

BroadsheetSeller_34.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_34.text: Where's Mol? Did she make it to the city too?

BroadsheetSeller_10.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_10.text: Oh, um, she's very busy. I think she's made new f-friends in the city.

BroadsheetSeller_26.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_26.text: I'm going to join her there when the gates open.

BroadsheetSeller_7.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_7.text: Thank you! My first sale! I can't wait to tell Mol.
BroadsheetSeller_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy hands over the paper (unseen)

BroadsheetSeller_43.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_43.text: Another sale! I think I'm getting the hang of this.
BroadsheetSeller_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy hands over the paper (unseen)

BroadsheetSeller_15.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_15.text: I wouldn't be caught dead reading that useless rag.

BroadsheetSeller_18.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_18.text: Oh. Well, um... I'll be sure to pass on your comments to the editor.

BroadsheetSeller_1.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_1.text: SELL YOUR WARES LOUDER, LITTLE FRIEND! TRY SHOUTING!

BroadsheetSeller_12.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_12.text: Um... Okay... CAN I INTEREST YOU IN A C-COPY OF THE BALDUR'S MOUTH GAZETTE? ...Ple- PLEASE?
BroadsheetSeller_12.context: NodeContext: shouting, but uncomfortable with doing so

BroadsheetSeller_40.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_40.text: Oh, I'm just no good at shouting. I'll never sell this broadsheet.

BroadsheetSeller_39.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_39.text: Oh. C-come back again if you change your mind.

BroadsheetSeller_11.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_11.text: How about it? I've got a copy of the Gazette with your name on it... ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

BroadsheetSeller_36.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_36.text: Your sales technique's improving - I'll give you that.

BroadsheetSeller_37.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_37.text: The first sale was the hardest. Once I sold to you, I just kept going!

BroadsheetSeller_16.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_16.text: Want to buy another one? Today's is particularly legible. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

BroadsheetSeller_41.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_41.text: N-nothing to it really. The secret is saying things very loudly.
BroadsheetSeller_41.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have figured this out

BroadsheetSeller_9.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_9.text: So, how's about buying a copy of today's edition? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
BroadsheetSeller_9.context: NodeContext: Adopting an awkward sales voice - slightly too loud

BroadsheetSeller_42.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_42.text: There's a wonderful article about me in there. Would you like me to sign it?

BroadsheetSeller_3.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_3.text: Um... no, it's okay. I don't think Mr Needle would like that very much. We're not supposed to, um, deface the merchandise.
BroadsheetSeller_3.context: NodeContext: Trying to politely refuse, finiding it hard to say no to an adult. 'Deface' is an unfamiliar word, Silfy's quoting Mr. Needle without knowing exactly what it means

BroadsheetSeller_6.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_6.text: How about I sell you a copy, and then you can draw on it all you want? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

BroadsheetSeller_4.speaker: Player
BroadsheetSeller_4.text: Oh, sweet child. That rag isn't worth the paper it's printed on. It's full of lies.

BroadsheetSeller_25.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_25.text: It is? Oh, well... um... the truth depends on who you ask, doesn't it?
BroadsheetSeller_25.context: NodeContext: Momentarily thrown/confused - this never occurred to her

BroadsheetSeller_8.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_8.text: It's, um, relative. Doesn't mean it's not worth reading. So what do you say - buy a copy? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
BroadsheetSeller_8.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly using an adult phrase she's picked up somewhere

BroadsheetSeller_38.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_38.text: If you don't like today's news, come back tomorrow. It changes every day!
BroadsheetSeller_38.context: NodeContext: Growing confidence, Like she's amazed at the fact the news changes daily

BroadsheetSeller_28.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_28.text: I - I can't. I'm supposed to stand here. You don't have to buy one.

BroadsheetSeller_29.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_29.text: Changed your mind? Go on - buy a Gazette. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

BroadsheetSeller_31.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_31.text: Come back tomorrow for the next edition.

BroadsheetSeller_33.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_33.text: Sorry, can't talk. I might miss my next customer.

BroadsheetSeller_35.speaker: Silfy
BroadsheetSeller_35.text: Baldur's Mouth Gazette. For stories with, um, teeth? Buy a copy? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
BroadsheetSeller_35.context: NodeContext: nervous sales attempt, reciting a script

Pigeon_002_2.speaker: Pigeon
Pigeon_002_2.text: I've no need of a wingman. Commander Lightfeather will give you your briefing.
Pigeon_002_2.context: NodeContext: Too busy, dismissing a junior officer

GalesTressym_85.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_85.text: I'd like to know if you have any other interesting objects to trade.

GalesTressym_21.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_21.text: I've a nose for the things, in fact.

GalesTressym_25.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_25.text: *The tressym is at its ease, a glint of satisfaction in her sparkling eye.*

GalesTressym_136.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_136.text: Have you got any other magic objects you'd be willing to part with?

GalesTressym_87.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_87.text: I may, or I may not. Depends what you have to offer in return. I have very high standards, mind.

GalesTressym_74.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_74.text: *The tressym looks at you expectantly, a shiny ring at its feet.*

GalesTressym_36.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_36.text: Open your pack and offer a trade.

GalesTressym_92.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_92.context: NodeContext: Pretending she doesn't speak Common.

GalesTressym_110.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_110.text: Do I look like I have anything else to say to you, darling?

GalesTressym_120.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_120.text: Oh - that's quite all right. I don't need anything else from you.

GalesTressym_123.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_123.context: NodeContext: Pretending she doesn't speak Common.

GalesTressym_112.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_112.text: *You notice the tressym guards a shiny ring and stack of letters at its feet.*

GalesTressym_168.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_168.text: *The tressym seems nervous, but you can't quite tell why.*

GalesTressym_156.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_156.text: Sorry, I don't believe we've met. Or if we have, let's pretend we haven't.
GalesTressym_156.context: NodeContext: Coy, she's pretending not to know the player.

GalesTressym_3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_3.text: Nice to see you too, Mr Dekarios.

GalesTressym_148.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_148.text: What are you doing here, kitty?

GalesTressym_151.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_151.text: Kitty? How vulgar. You can call me - actually, it's better if you don't call me at all. That'll be all, thank you.

GalesTressym_80.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_80.text: What sharp claws and teeth you have. You wouldn't have anything to do with some missing messenger pigeons, would you?

GalesTressym_42.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_42.text: Please. I don't dirty my paws for anything less than pheasant. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm busy luxuriating in solitude.

GalesTressym_166.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_166.text: Are you sure? I'd hate for anything abrupt to happen while I'm seeking out the culprit.

GalesTressym_24.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_24.text: If I didn't know better, I'd think you were threatening me.

GalesTressym_91.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_91.text: I ate the pigeons. Are you satisfied? I prevaricated before. Pigeon is my second-most-favourite meat.

GalesTressym_137.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_137.text: I shalln't be bullied, harangued, or deceived. Do you hear?
GalesTressym_137.context: InternalNodeContext: TAra shoots fireball at player

GalesTressym_55.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_55.text: I'll happily leave you be, as soon as I find out what happened to those pigeons.

GalesTressym_63.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_63.text: Ugh. If it'll hasten your departure...

GalesTressym_65.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_65.text: I've been sent here to take you in for questioning. You can avoid an unpleasant trip inside if you tell me the truth now.

GalesTressym_56.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_56.text: Like you'd be able to lay so much as a finger on me. Still, I've no desire to watch you flail about in the attempt.

GalesTressym_174.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_174.text: Quite a nice ring you have there. What are you going to do with it?

GalesTressym_132.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_132.text: That's for me to know, isn't it?

GalesTressym_41.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_41.text: I could really use such an artefact in my fight against evil.

GalesTressym_52.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_52.text: Ugh. Take it. Curse this bleeding heart of mine. But use it well, you hear?

GalesTressym_13.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_13.text: About the missing pigeons in the post house...

GalesTressym_68.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_68.text: What of them? I don't dirty my paws for anything less than pheasant, I'll have you know.

GalesTressym_0.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_0.text: Thank you! I'll take my leave.

GalesTressym_20.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_20.text: Well, I never! Keep it, then, you lout.

GalesTressym_173.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_173.text: Tut tut, what manners! Good day to you!
GalesTressym_173.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's attempt for the ring fails/ they whiff it.

GalesTressym_130.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_130.text: From the look of those letters, one might guess you've been eating carrier pigeons.

GalesTressym_69.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_69.text: From the look of those letters, one might guess you were responsible for the post house's missing pigeons.

GalesTressym_119.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_119.text: One needn't guess. Pigeon meat is my second-favourite.

GalesTressym_102.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_102.text: Those letters are important. You shouldn't be eating their messengers.

GalesTressym_70.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_70.text: Importance is relative. A letter may be important to one; a growling belly may be more important to another.

GalesTressym_169.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_169.text: But let's not get bogged down in semantics. I believe you were just leaving, weren't you? Taaa!

GalesTressym_147.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_147.text: No! Leave these pigeons be or I'll eat you.

GalesTressym_88.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_88.text: Hah! I'd actually enjoy watching you try.

GalesTressym_28.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_28.text: But let's not allow our baser natures to prevail. In truth, I've grown tired of this rooftop anyway.

GalesTressym_6.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_6.text: I'll be on my way, then. There are a few places in the city I'd like to visit. I might've sussed some interesting items I'd rather like to get my paws upon.

GalesTressym_84.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_84.text: If I find anything interesting, I might even be willing to barter. Might. Tara - away!

GalesTressym_86.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_86.text: How very dare you! How very dare you indeed!
GalesTressym_86.context: InternalNodeContext: TAra shoots fireball at player

GalesTressym_116.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_116.text: I'm not leaving 'til you agree to stop hunting these pigeons.

GalesTressym_4.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_4.text: Ugh. In service of not having to make any further conversation with you, I concede.

GalesTressym_49.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_49.text: That's fine. But don't expect me to entertain you.

GalesTressym_159.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_159.text: There's a much better aviary across town, if you've already picked over the choice cuts here.

GalesTressym_89.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_89.text: Another aviary, you say? Well, that does sound quite interesting. The brood here is getting a little thin.

GalesTressym_61.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_61.text: Perhaps while I'm seeking out this new feasthall, I'll pay a few visits around town. I might've sussed some interesting items I'd rather like to get my paws upon.

GalesTressym_32.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_32.text: I doubt you know the first thing about choosing pigeon meat. As such, I'll be ignoring you starting... now.

GalesTressym_101.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_101.text: Thank you. I most certainly will. When I've had my fill of the local fare, I may look for more interesting pastures.

GalesTressym_60.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_60.text: There are a few places in the city I'd like to visit. I might've sussed some interesting items I'd rather like to get my paws upon.

GalesTressym_172.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_172.text: If pigeon is your second-favourite, what's your first?

GalesTressym_100.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_100.text: Beholder, but it's exceedingly rare to come by.

GalesTressym_129.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_129.text: A tressym doesn't hunt; she locks into a sacred dance with her prey - one as elemental as it is ancient.

GalesTressym_82.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_82.text: But anyway - thank you. It will be happy indeed.

GalesTressym_171.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_171.text: *You notice the tressym guards a shiny ring and stack of letters at its feet.*

GalesTressym_10.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_10.text: *You grab the ring, spooking the tressym.*

GalesTressym_57.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_57.text: *You dive forward but miss the ring entirely. The tressym flies away, and the ring disappears with her.*

GalesTressym_93.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_93.text: Gently approach the tressym and attempt to take the ring without alarming her.

GalesTressym_99.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_99.text: *She doesn't seem to mind. You take the ring without so much as a 'mew'.*

GalesTressym_15.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_15.text: *She startles, and you miss the ring. She flies away before you can make a second attempt.*
GalesTressym_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: She startles and flies away.

GalesTressym_109.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_109.text: Try to discern the nature of the creature's ill temper.

GalesTressym_108.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_108.text: *As you assess the creature, you notice a stack of letters and shiny ring at the creature's feet.*

GalesTressym_77.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: She startles and flies away.

GalesTressym_19.speaker: Tara the Tressym
GalesTressym_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player appraoches to pet Tara but she growls, warning them away.NodeContext: She snarls, warning the player away

GalesTressym_149.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_149.text: *The tressym seems a little tense, but you aren't sure why.*

GalesTressym_157.speaker: Narrator
GalesTressym_157.text: *The tressym looks at you expectantly, a shiny ring at its feet.*

GalesTressym_154.speaker: Player
GalesTressym_154.text: Open your pack and offer a trade.
